snippet.textDisplay:
I just saw your show on history channel, and i have to say it, i'm proud of you Man, because it took you a long ride, but you finally got what you wanted and not everyone can. You can live working on what you love, you became known on YouTube and outside of it.
I'm watching your channel before the katana build, and it's amazing what you've done.
Keep the good work, and never stop being yourself, because that funny, energetic, curious and friendly actitude of yours Is a big part of what took you this far, hope this Is not the limit, because you can keep on climbing.
Greetings from an argentinian follower.
The best of lucks 🤟😎

I just saw your show on history channel, and i have to say it, i'm proud of you Man, because it took you a long ride, but you finally got what you wanted and not everyone can. You can live working on what you love, you became known on YouTube and outside of it.

Keep the good work, and never stop being yourself, because  that funny, energetic, curious and friendly actitude of yours Is a big part of what took you this far, hope this Is not the limit, because you can keep on climbing.
Greetings from an argentinian follower.
The best of lucks 🤟😎

snippet.textDisplay: If the number of layers is 2 million then each layer is 0.00000119 of a inch. The size of a atom in inches is about 0.000000000394. So each layer is about 0.0003310924 of an atom. PS there's about a 0.08423865 percent chance that's right.
snippet.textOriginal: If the number of layers is 2 million then each layer is 0.00000119 of a inch. The size of a atom in inches is about 0.000000000394. So each layer is about 0.0003310924 of an atom. PS there's about a 0.08423865 percent chance that's right.

snippet.textDisplay: Iron has a metallic atomic radius of 126 pm, meaning the width of an iron atom in a lump of iron is around 252 pm. Assuming the final billet is around 1 cm thick, and has 2 million layers, each layer is 0.000005 mm thick, or 5000 pm. 5000 pm divided by the width of an iron atom (252 pm) gives a number of just under 20 atoms per layer.
snippet.textOriginal: Iron has a metallic atomic radius of 126 pm, meaning the width of an iron atom in a lump of iron is around 252 pm. Assuming the final billet is around 1 cm thick, and has 2 million layers, each layer is 0.000005 mm thick, or 5000 pm. 5000 pm divided by the width of an iron atom (252 pm) gives a number of just under 20 atoms per layer.

snippet.textDisplay: Why make everything Damascus? I have a knife made with Elmax steel and another in S30v. I've never sharpened either of them ever and my stones would barely cut steel that hard anyway. Only ever used a strop like once on the S30v and its still shaving sharp. I'd like to see a super high quality usable knife or large utilitarian knife project.
snippet.textOriginal: Why make everything Damascus? I have a knife made with Elmax steel and another in S30v. I've never sharpened either of them ever and my stones would barely cut steel that hard anyway. Only ever used a strop like once on the S30v and its still shaving sharp. I'd like to see a super high quality usable knife or large utilitarian knife project.
